oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Lyman Draper
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Head shot of an aged Lyman Copeland Draper (1815-1891). He is wearing a jacket with high collar and has thick sideburns [mutton chops].

Secretary and librarian of the Wisconsin Historical Society (1854-1886), which he turned into one of the great repositories of early American history, principally through his collecting of documents and interviews pertaining to the Old Southwest frontier.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Howell, William R., -1890
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Draper, Lyman Copeland, 1815-1891
